Name: Physics for Rock Stars: Making the Laws of the Universe Work for You

ReviewList.Text: Loved it!!! My favorite kind of book. Beyond clever humor sprinkled through legit "sexy" science chapters including the footnotes and appendix (don't miss those!). Now, I really understand the laws of physics!!!

This book sees real life, everyday, human experiences thru a slightly scientific lens — no one has to be a rocket scientist to understand the laws of gravity, energy, momentum and how you can apply the physical basics to enhance the quality and understanding of our every day lives. The world sometimes feel like a confusing and chaotic place, but science is concrete -- it's comforting to know these things. On the flip side, non-science people maybe see the world thru art, words/language, or business/economics but those things are transient and bias, there’s too many languages to keep track of, art is subjective, and who the hell can trust business and economics… science is science and its’ a universal language. Christine McKinley does a superb job of breaking down the laws of physics to accomplish anything you want in this life. I recommend this book to all rockstars, runway models, astrophysicists, ninjas, and anyone else in between!
This is an outstanding book. Christine makes learning and understanding physics an enjoyable adventure. I highly recommend the book.
A whole new approach to physics! I'm ordering this as Christmas presents!

Excellent book by a wonderful author/scientist.  My college Honors class read the book and it was very well received.  Christine McKinley mixes physics with life in a way that is educational and enjoyable.  My non science majors loved it as much as my science students.  Christine also served as our guest lecturer for a community event and the place was packed.  I'm still getting compliments on her presentation and kudos for bringing the book and author to campus.

Wonderful book by an interesting woman. It is sort of an Autobiography. Christine is an Engineer & Plays bass in a band. She gives very clear explanations of the laws of physics & uses examples that are easy for anyone to understand. She is an excellent writer. The book is fun to read and would be helpful for anyone who teaches physics in an academic or non traditional classroom.
Still reading but enjoying this review as I studied this in high school.  Her explanations are very easy to comprehend.
